title: How to clean up audio distortion on VLC Media PLayer?
body: If there is at least about a second that you can identify as just noise (when nobody's speaking), you can try cleaning it up in Audacity (freeware). Select that part, choose Effect->Noise Reduction and click "Get Noise Profile". Now select everything, and invoke Noise Reduction again, that's it. The first time you do that, you give it an idea ...
readable_content:
- chuckz1487 (2016-12-08): How to clean up audio distortion on VLC Media Player?
    I have a trial this upcoming week and the video I have has pretty shitty sound quality. Where and how should I mess with parameters to fix the audio? It has a lot of distortion and background noise. Its the audio from the back of a cop car. So there is traffic and city noise pollution. Please let me know, this would be greatly appreciated :)
- 22Sharpe (2016-12-08): VLC is a player, not an audio editor. Cleaning up audio like that (especially if there is dialogue is consider) is no easy task and will require an actual editing program.
